qas.question: What are two of the large non-state run research institutions in Portugal?

answers.text: Instituto Gulbenkian de Ciência and the Champalimaud Foundation

qas.question: What does the Champalimaud Foundation award every year?

answers.text: one of the highest monetary prizes of any science prize in the world

qas.question: In what year was the Sciences Academy of Lisbon founded?

context: Among the largest non-state-run research institutions in Portugal are the <a0_0>Instituto Gulbenkian de Ciência and the Champalimaud Foundation<a0_0/>, a <a1_0>neuroscience and oncology research centre<a1_0/>, which in addition awards every year <a2_0>one of the highest monetary prizes of any science prize in the world<a2_0/>. A number of both national and multinational high-tech and industrial companies, are also responsible for research and development projects. One of the oldest learned societies of Portugal is the Sciences Academy of Lisbon, founded in <a3_0>1779<a3_0/>.
